definition: happy/carefree/at one's ease/variant of 預|预[yu4]/old variant of 與|与[yu4]
abbr. for Henan province 河南 in central China
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: My granny is an expert of Henan Opera.
Henan Opera aria music belongs to the system of Banqiang-style clapper melody.
sentences.chinese: 豫剧唱腔音乐属板腔体梆子腔系统。

sentences.english: Difficult to Henan Opera, Peking Opera Huangmeixi than poor, and so on?
sentences.chinese: 难到豫剧，黄梅戏等就比京剧差吗？

sentences.english: Yu Opera of Henan, the largest province in China, is only second to Peking Opera.
sentences.chinese: 河南是中国第一大省，豫剧是与京剧齐名的剧种之一。

sentences.english: The town's theatrical group will come to our village and perform Henan opera soon.
sentences.chinese: 县里的剧团将于近期到我们乡表演豫剧。

sentences.english: Henan Opera is more ancient than the Peking Opera .
sentences.chinese: 豫剧是比京剧更古老的剧种。

definition: local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
Qinqiang, an opera style popular in northwest China, possibly originating in Ming dynasty folk music/Shaanxi opera
genre of song-and-dance duet popular in Inner Mongolia
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
